content:
I think there may be some confusion! Manchester City and Chelsea did play in the 2020-21 UEFA Champions League final, but it was Chelsea who won the title, not Manchester City.

Now, to answer your question, the team that has won the most titles in the UEFA Champions League's history is Real Madrid, with a record 13 titles:

1. 1956: Real Madrid defeated Stade de Reims 4-3 in the final
2. 1957: Real Madrid defeated Fiorentina 2-0 in the final
3. 1958: Real Madrid defeated AC Milan 3-2 in the final
4. 1959: Real Madrid defeated Stade de Reims 2-2 (Real Madrid won 2-1 in the replay)
5. 1960: Real Madrid defeated Eintracht Frankfurt 7-3 in the final
6. 1966: Real Madrid defeated Partizan Belgrade 2-1 in the final
7. 1998: Real Madrid defeated Juventus 1-0 in the final
8. 2000: Real Madrid defeated Valencia 3-0 in the final
9. 2002: Real Madrid defeated Bayer Leverkusen 2-1 in the final
10. 2014: Real Madrid defeated Atlético Madrid 4-1 in the final (after extra time)
11. 2016: Real Madrid defeated Atlético Madrid 5-3 in the final (after penalties)
12. 2017: Real Madrid defeated Juventus 4-1 in the final
13. 2018: Real Madrid defeated Liverpool 3-1 in the final

AC Milan is second on the list with 7 titles, and Liverpool is third with 6 titles.

I hope this information helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.
